meanings.def: a piece of cloth that is hung to cover a window
examples: to draw/pull/close the curtains (= to pull them across the window so they cover it)
She opened her curtains and looked out.
It was ten in the morning but the curtains were still drawn (= closed).
a pair of curtains
She looked up and saw a face peering through the curtains.
Heavy red velvet curtains hung either side of the huge window.
She pulled back the curtains, and sunlight streamed in.
The curtains billowed as the wind caught them.
They sat in the dark with the curtains drawn.

meanings.def: a very thin piece of cloth that you hang at a window and that allows light to enter but stops people outside from being able to see inside
a piece of cloth that is hung up as a screen in a room or around a bed, for example
examples: a shower curtain
He took a bag from a shelf behind some curtains.

meanings.def: a piece of thick, heavy cloth that hangs in front of the stage in the theatre
examples: The audience was waiting for the curtain to rise (= for the play to begin).
The curtain goes up to reveal a grand piano at the back of the stage.
There was tremendous applause when the curtain came down (= the play ended).
We left just before the final curtain (= the end of a play).
(figurative) It's time to face the final curtain (= the end; death).
(figurative) The curtain has fallen on her long and distinguished career (= her career has ended).

meanings.def: a thing that covers, hides or protects something
examples: a curtain of rain/smoke
She pushed back the curtain of brown hair from her eyes.

meanings.def: to be a situation without hope or that you cannot escape from
examples: When I saw he had a gun, I thought it was curtains for me.

meanings.def: to finish or mark the end of something
examples: His sudden decision to retire brought down the curtain on a distinguished career.

idioms.def: to be a situation without hope or that you cannot escape from
examples: When I saw he had a gun, I thought it was curtains for me.

idioms.idiom: bring down the curtain on something | bring the curtain down on something
idioms.def: to finish or mark the end of something
examples: His sudden decision to retire brought down the curtain on a distinguished career.

meanings.def: to provide curtains for a window or a room
